resources.string:
Some skills and competences are important throughout your working life and, especially in the selection process, can make the difference between you being – or not – invited to a job interview.
The ability to work under pressure and autonomously - doing what you have to do, even when no one is looking -, for example, are increasingly valued by companies. Communication , Focus on results ,Leadership ,Autonomy ,Hands on ,Owners thinking ,Emotional intelligence ,Flexibility and ability to adapt to changes ,Creativity ,Continuous learning ,Critical thinking ,Professional resilience ,Collaboration and teamwork ,Ability to work remotely ,Commitment ,Capacity for innovation
